titles.title: To facilitate the sale of certain land in Tahoe National Forest, in the State of California to Placer County, California.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 105-114.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 69.

action.text: Mrs. Chenoweth moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Forests and Public Lands. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of Agriculture and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 105-231.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 445.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/3/1997--Passed House amended. Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture, subject to all valid existing rights, to sell to Placer County, California, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to a specified parcel of real property located in Tahoe National Forest, California, to permit the County to create a community park in Squaw Valley. Requires the County to pay to the United States the fair market value of the parcel which shall be deposited in the fund established by the Sisk Act and made available for expenditure in accordance with such Act. Conditions such conveyance upon the County agreeing to provide for continuation of any existing non-Federal improvements or uses on the parcel for the remainder of the terms of the existing authorization.
